hero.title: Study in Sweden and the EU
hero.subtitle: Pursue your academic dreams in Europe's top universities with expert guidance from Sweden Relocators AB

intro.heading: Your Gateway to European Education
intro.description: Sweden and the European Union offer world-class education with affordable tuition, English-taught programs, and excellent post-study opportunities. Whether you aspire to study engineering in Sweden, business in Denmark, or medicine in Germany, we guide you through every step of the admission and visa process.

countries.name: Study in Sweden
countries.intro: Sweden is one of Europe's most popular destinations for international students. With globally ranked universities, innovative teaching methods, and a strong reputation for research, it offers both high-quality education and an excellent lifestyle.

fees.amount: SEK 80,000 – 295,000 (€7,500 – €25,500) depending on program and university

countries.popularFields: Engineering, IT, Business, Life Sciences, Environmental Studies

visaRequirements.heading: Visa and Residence Requirements
requirements: EU/EEA: No visa required
Non-EU/EEA: Residence permit required for studies longer than three months
Proof of funds: approx. SEK 10,300 per month for living costs
Health insurance required for stays under one year

countries.workRights: Students can work unlimited hours during studies, and after graduation can apply for a one-year post-study residence permit to find a job or start a business.

countries.name: Study in Denmark
countries.intro: Denmark combines academic excellence with a business-friendly environment. Over 500 English-taught programs are offered across leading universities and colleges.

intakes.details: Applications close in March (studies start in August/September)
Applications close in September (studies start in January/February, limited courses)

countries.popularFields: Design, Architecture, Business, Engineering, IT, Life Sciences

visaRequirements.heading: Visa and Residence Requirements
requirements: Proof of funds: approx. €1,000 per month for living expenses
Health insurance must be secured before arrival

countries.workRights: Students can work up to 20 hours per week during semesters and full-time during holidays.

countries.name: Study in Germany
countries.intro: Germany is one of the most affordable and attractive study destinations in Europe, with nearly 400,000 international students.
countries.popularFields: Engineering, Business, Computer Science, Medicine, Natural Sciences

visaRequirements.heading: Visa and Residence Requirements
requirements: Proof of finances: approx. €11,000 per year in a blocked account
Mandatory health insurance required

countries.workRights: 20 hours per week during semester, full-time during breaks.

countries.name: Study in the United Kingdom
countries.intro: The UK is home to some of the world's top universities and an internationally recognized degree system.
countries.popularFields: Law, Business, Engineering, Medicine, Social Sciences

visaRequirements.heading: Visa and Residence Requirements
requirements: Student visa required for non-EU/EEA
Proof of tuition paid plus €1,200 per month (London) or lower outside London

countries.workRights: 20 hours per week during term, full-time during vacations.

countries.name: Study in Latvia
countries.intro: Latvia provides affordable education and peaceful living conditions.

visaRequirements.heading: Visa and Residence Requirements
requirements: Student visa and proof of living expenses required
Health insurance mandatory

countries.name: Study in Lithuania
countries.intro: Lithuania offers strong academic traditions and over 350 English-taught programs.

visaRequirements.heading: Visa and Residence Requirements
requirements: Residence permit required for non-EU students
Financial proof and insurance needed

countries.name: Study in Czech Republic
countries.intro: The Czech Republic is a growing destination for international students in Central Europe.

visaRequirements.heading: Visa and Residence Requirements
requirements: Student visa required for non-EU students
Proof of finances and accommodation must be shown

countries.name: Study in Norway
countries.intro: Norway is known for tuition-free education at public universities.
countries.popularFields: Energy, Marine Sciences, Engineering, IT, Natural Sciences

visaRequirements.heading: Visa and Residence Requirements
requirements: Proof of approx. €12,000 per year for living costs required
Health insurance mandatory

countries.workRights: 20 hours per week during semester, full-time during holidays.

countries.name: Study in Finland
countries.intro: Finland offers modern education and a strong focus on research and innovation.

intakes.details: Secondary intake, limited programs — applications in September

visaRequirements.heading: Visa and Residence Requirements
requirements: Residence permit required for non-EU students
Proof of funds: minimum €800 per month (€9,600 per year)
Health insurance required

countries.workRights: Students may work 20–25 hours per week during semesters and full-time during holidays. Post-study work permit available for graduates.

whyChoose.heading: Why Choose Sweden Relocators AB

services.title: Complete Admission Guidance
services.description: Complete admission guidance for Bachelor's, Master's, and PhD programs across Sweden and the EU

services.title: Document Services
services.description: Document attestation, translation, and preparation for universities and migration authorities

services.title: Visa and Residence Support
services.description: Visa and residence permit applications handled with precision

services.title: Financial Assistance
services.description: Scholarship and financial advice tailored to each country

services.title: Post-Study Support
services.description: Ongoing support for residence permit renewal and post-study employment

whyChoose.description: At Sweden Relocators AB, we make studying in Sweden and Europe simple, transparent, and stress-free. From your first application to your graduation and beyond, we guide you every step of the way.

cta.heading: Begin Your Study Journey in Europe Today
cta.description: Contact Sweden Relocators to get expert guidance on your application and visa process.
cta.subtext: Education regulations vary by country. Always consult official university and immigration websites for the most current information.
